TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DeviceAdminReceiver extends Android.Content.BroadcastReceiver

Docs.summary: Base class for implementing a device administration component.

remarks.para: Base class for implementing a device administration component. This class provides a convenience for interpreting the raw intent actions that are sent by the system.

The callback methods, like the base
method, happen on the main thread of the process. Thus long running operations must be done on another thread. Note that because a receiver is done once returning from its receive function, such long-running operations should probably be done in a .
<receiver android:name=".app.DeviceAdminSample$DeviceAdminSampleReceiver" android:label="@string/sample_device_admin" android:description="@string/sample_device_admin_description" android:permission="android.permission.BIND_DEVICE_ADMIN"> <meta-data android:name="android.app.device_admin" android:resource="@xml/device_admin_sample" /> <intent-filter> <action android:name="android.app.action.DEVICE_ADMIN_ENABLED" /> </intent-filter> </receiver><device-admin xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"> <uses-policies> <limit-password /> <watch-login /> <reset-password /> <force-lock /> <wipe-data /> <expire-password /> <encrypted-storage /> <disable-camera /> <disable-keyguard-features /> </uses-policies> </device-admin>
Developer Guides
When publishing your DeviceAdmin subclass as a receiver, it must handle and require the permission. A typical manifest entry would look like:
The meta-data referenced here provides addition information specific to the device administrator, as parsed by the class. A typical file would be:
For more information about device administration, read the Device Administration developer guide.

Docs.param: A containing a Java Native Interface (JNI) object reference.
Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

Docs.summary: Action sent to a device administrator when the user has disabled it.

remarks.para: Action sent to a device administrator when the user has disabled it. Upon return, the application no longer has access to the protected device policy manager APIs. You will generally handle this in . Note that this action will be sent the receiver regardless of whether it is explicitly listed in its intent filter.

Docs.summary: Action sent to a device administrator when the user has requested to disable it, but before this has actually been done.

remarks.para: Action sent to a device administrator when the user has requested to disable it, but before this has actually been done. This gives you a chance to supply a message to the user about the impact of disabling your admin, by setting the extra field in the result Intent. If not set, no warning will be displayed. If set, the given text will be shown to the user before they disable your admin.

Docs.summary: This is the primary action that a device administrator must implement to be allowed to manage a device.

remarks.para: This is the primary action that a device administrator must implement to be allowed to manage a device. This will be set to the receiver when the user enables it for administration. You will generally handle this in . To be supported, the receiver must also require the permission so that other applications can not abuse it.

Docs.summary: Action sent to a device administrator to notify that the device is entering lock task mode from an authorized package.

remarks.para: Action sent to a device administrator to notify that the device is entering lock task mode from an authorized package. The extra will describe the authorized package using lock task mode.

Docs.summary: Action sent to a device administrator to notify that the device is exiting lock task mode from an authorized package.

remarks.para: Action sent to a device administrator to notify that the device is exiting lock task mode from an authorized package.

Docs.summary: Action sent to a device administrator when the user has changed the password of their device.

remarks.para: Action sent to a device administrator when the user has changed the password of their device. You can at this point check the characteristics of the new password with . You will generally handle this in .
The calling device admin must have requested to receive this broadcast.

Docs.summary: Action periodically sent to a device administrator when the device password is expiring.

remarks.para: Action periodically sent to a device administrator when the device password is expiring.
The calling device admin must have requested to receive this broadcast.

Docs.summary: Action sent to a device administrator when the user has failed at attempted to enter the password.

remarks.para: Action sent to a device administrator when the user has failed at attempted to enter the password. You can at this point check the number of failed password attempts there have been with . You will generally handle this in .
The calling device admin must have requested to receive this broadcast.

Docs.summary: Action sent to a device administrator when the user has successfully entered their password, after failing one or more times.

remarks.para: Action sent to a device administrator when the user has successfully entered their password, after failing one or more times.
The calling device admin must have requested to receive this broadcast.

Docs.summary: Broadcast Action: This broadcast is sent to indicate that provisioning of a managed profile or managed device has completed successfully.

remarks.para: Broadcast Action: This broadcast is sent to indicate that provisioning of a managed profile or managed device has completed successfully.

The broadcast is limited to the profile that will be managed by the application that requested provisioning. In the device owner case the profile is the primary user. The broadcast will also be limited to the component specified in the original intent or NFC bump that started the provisioning process (@see DevicePolicyManager#ACTION_PROVISION_MANAGED_PROFILE).
A device admin application which listens to this intent can find out if the device was provisioned for the device owner or profile owner case by calling respectively and .
Input: Nothing.
Output: Nothing

Docs.summary: Name under which a DevicePolicy component publishes information about itself.

remarks.para: Name under which a DevicePolicy component publishes information about itself. This meta-data must reference an XML resource containing a device-admin tag. XXX TO DO: describe syntax.

Docs.summary: A CharSequence that can be shown to the user informing them of the impact of disabling your admin.

remarks.para: A CharSequence that can be shown to the user informing them of the impact of disabling your admin.

Docs.summary: A boolean describing whether the device is currently entering or exiting lock task mode.

remarks.para: A boolean describing whether the device is currently entering or exiting lock task mode.

Docs.summary: Called when the user has asked to disable the administrator, as a result of receiving , giving you a chance to present a warning message to them.

remarks.para: Called when the user has asked to disable the administrator, as a result of receiving , giving you a chance to present a warning message to them. The message is returned as the result; if null is returned (the default implementation), no message will be displayed.

Docs.summary: Called after the administrator is first enabled, as a result of receiving .

remarks.para: Called after the administrator is first enabled, as a result of receiving . At this point you can use to set your desired policies.
If the admin is activated by a device owner, then the intent may contain private extras that are relevant to user setup.

Docs.summary: Called after the user has changed their password, as a result of receiving .

remarks.para: Called after the user has changed their password, as a result of receiving . At this point you can use to retrieve the active password characteristics.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void OnPasswordExpiring (Android.Content.Context context, Android.Content.Intent intent);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnPasswordExpiring(class Android.Content.Context context, class Android.Content.Intent intent) cil managed

Docs.summary: Called periodically when the password is about to expire or has expired.

remarks.para: Called periodically when the password is about to expire or has expired. It will typically be called at these times: on device boot, once per day before the password expires, and at the time when the password expires.
If the password is not updated by the user, this method will continue to be called once per day until the password is changed or the device admin disables password expiration.
The admin will typically post a notification requesting the user to change their password in response to this call. The actual password expiration time can be obtained by calling
The admin should be sure to take down any notifications it posted in response to this call when it receives .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void OnPasswordFailed (Android.Content.Context context, Android.Content.Intent intent);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnPasswordFailed(class Android.Content.Context context, class Android.Content.Intent intent) cil managed

Docs.summary: Called after the user has failed at entering their current password, as a result of receiving .

remarks.para: Called after the user has failed at entering their current password, as a result of receiving . At this point you can use to retrieve the number of failed password attempts.

Docs.summary: Called after the user has succeeded at entering their current password, as a result of receiving .

remarks.para: Called after the user has succeeded at entering their current password, as a result of receiving . This will only be received the first time they succeed after having previously failed.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void OnProfileProvisioningComplete (Android.Content.Context context, Android.Content.Intent intent);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnProfileProvisioningComplete(class Android.Content.Context context, class Android.Content.Intent intent) cil managed

Docs.summary: Called when provisioning of a managed profile or managed device has completed successfully.

remarks.para: Called when provisioning of a managed profile or managed device has completed successfully.

As a prerequisit for the execution of this callback the (@link DeviceAdminReceiver} has to declare an intent filter for . Its component must also be specified in the of the intent that started the managed provisioning.

When provisioning is complete, the managed profile is hidden until the profile owner calls {DevicePolicyManager#setProfileEnabled(ComponentName admin)}. Typically a profile owner will enable the profile when it has finished any additional setup such as adding an account by using the and calling apis to bring the profile into the desired state.

Note that provisioning completes without waiting for any server interactions, so the profile owner needs to wait for data to be available if required (e.g android device ids or other data that is set as a result of server interactions).

MemberSignature.Value: public override void OnReceive (Android.Content.Context context, Android.Content.Intent intent);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void OnReceive(class Android.Content.Context context, class Android.Content.Intent intent) cil managed

Docs.param: The Context in which the receiver is running.
Docs.summary: Intercept standard device administrator broadcasts.

remarks.para: Intercept standard device administrator broadcasts. Implementations should not override this method; it is better to implement the convenience callbacks for each action.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
